sn12.58:4.2: “There are things that are prone to being fettered. When you concentrate on the gratification provided by these things, name and form is conceived.
sn12.58:4.3: Name and form is a condition for the six sense fields. …
sn12.58:4.4: That is how this entire mass of suffering originates.
sn12.58:5.1: Suppose there was a great tree.
sn12.58:5.2: And its roots going downwards and across all draw the sap upwards.
sn12.58:5.3: Fueled and sustained by that, the great tree would stand for a long time.
sn12.58:5.4: In the same way, there are things that are prone to being fettered. When you concentrate on the gratification provided by these things, name and form is conceived. …
sn12.58:6.1: There are things that are prone to being fettered. When you concentrate on the drawbacks of these things, name and form is not conceived.
sn12.58:6.2: When name and form cease, the six sense fields cease. …
sn12.58:6.3: That is how this entire mass of suffering ceases.
sn12.58:7.1: Suppose there was a great tree.
sn12.58:7.2: Then a person comes along with a spade and basket. …
sn12.58:7.3: In this way the great tree is cut off at the root, made like a palm stump, exterminated, and unable to arise in the future.
sn12.58:7.4: In the same way, there are things that are prone to being fettered. When you concentrate on the drawbacks of these things, name and form is not conceived.
sn12.58:7.5: When name and form cease, the six sense fields cease. …
sn12.58:7.6: That is how this entire mass of suffering ceases.”
